definition: special favor from a ruler/Emperor's generosity towards a favorite

sentences.english: And grace will lead us home.
sentences.chinese: 也恩宠于我们将要回家的领引。

sentences.english: Petition: Jesus, Good Shepherd, give me the grace to open my heart to your mercy.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣，善牧，求袮恩宠于我敞开心扉接纳袮的仁慈。

sentences.english: Whengrace is lost from life, come with a burst of song.
sentences.chinese: 当生命失去恩宠时，请赐我以欢歌。

sentences.english: I wait to bring the light of grace upon my children in this way.
sentences.chinese: 我正等著把这恩宠的光，照耀在我的孩子们身上。

sentences.english: We are all too young, a lot of things don't yet know, don't put the.
sentences.chinese: 我们都太年轻，很多事都还不了解，别把错爱当恩宠。

sentences.english: "How shall I get the grace of never judging my neighbor"?
sentences.chinese: 我要怎样才能蒙神恩宠绝不评论我的邻居呢？

sentences.english: But Paul choosing Silas, departed, being delivered by the brethren to the grace of God.
sentences.chinese: 保禄却拣选了息拉，蒙弟兄们将他托于主的恩宠以后。

sentences.english: I just want to be in good grace of my parents, not all others.
sentences.chinese: 他家里的每个孩子都受到其他人的恩宠。

sentences.english: They rightly do inherit heaven's graces.
sentences.chinese: 谁就恰当地承受上天的恩宠。

sentences.english: He occasionally singled me out for a display of favor.
sentences.chinese: 他有时把我抬出来夸奖一番以示恩宠。

definition: (old) (esp. of the Emperor) to show special favor towards
favor/to give charity to sb out of pity
to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
